keywords.value: OXLEY, J. LEONARD. PIANIST, CONDUCTOR, ARRANGER
keywords.name: persons

lead_paragraph: OXLEY--J. Leonard. Pianist, conductor, arrangerrchestrator. Age 87, of Teaneck, formerly of Harrisburg, PA passed away on Friday, February 19, 2016. Beloved husband of Nancy A. Oxley (nee Adams). Devoted father of Jill and her husband Ian. Loving grandfather of Anna. Dear brother of Eric Oxley. Dear brother-in-law to David and Ronald Adams. Predeceased by his sister Laura Lewis. Mr. Oxley had a career in Musical Theatre that spanned nearly 70 years. An extraordinary artist, he trained at Juilliard. Early in his career he was the Music Director at Harrisburg Community Theater, where he met his wife. He was a protege of esteemed Broadway composer Luther Henderson. Mr. Oxley was the Music Director of the New Jersey Tap Ensemble for the past 20 years. He accompanied and worked with some of theater's most celebrated artists, including Gregory Hines, Andre De Shields, Savion Glover, Phylicia Rashad, Nell Carter, Polly Bergen, Carol Channing, Mary Martin and Robert Preston. His numerous credits include Broadway, Off-Broadway, National and International tours of Ain't Misbehavin', Sophisticated Ladies, Black and Blue, Jelly's Last Jam, Big Deal, Andre Heller's Wonderhouse, Play On! and Hello Dolly. Family and friends are invited for a memorial visitation at the Volk Leber Funeral Home, 789 Teaneck Road, Teaneck on Wednesday from 1-3pm. Service will commence at 2:30pm. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions can be made to the St. Thomas Episcopal Church, 1 W. 53rd St, New York, NY 10019, stthomaschurch.org. To view J. Leonard's tribute page, please visit volkleber.com 1/3
